newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit eases on cross-selling vs Sing.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit eases on cross-selling vs Sing.

text.p: The ringgit was slightly lower in late Asian trading on fresh fund unwinding of long positions against the Singapore dollar, dealers said on Friday.
They said the unwinding was expected to continue through the evening, but at a slow pace as most players were cautious ahead of the Group-of-Seven meeting over the weekend.
"The unwinding was triggered by some perceived uncertainties in Malaysia like cabinet reshuffle," said a dealer with a Malaysian bank.
He said Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad's denial of rumour on Thursday had little impact on the market.
"The activity will be sharply reduced later today. Most of it will be position adjusting," another dealer said.
Dealers said the market was waiting for a fresh leads such as the February trade data, expected early next week.
At 0900 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.5075/85 a dollar and at 1.7355.74 a Singapore dollar.
